sen.j: 楠木 正時（くすのき まさとき、生年不詳 - 貞和4年/正平 (日本)3年1月5日 (旧暦)（1348年2月4日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Masatoki KUSUNOKI (the date of birth unknown – February 4, 1348) was a military commander during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Masatoki KUSUNOKI (the date of birth unknown – February 4, 1348) was a military commander during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Masatoki KUSUNOKI (the date of birth unknown – February 4, 1348) was a military commander during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 楠木正成の次男で、楠木正行の弟。
sen.e: He was the second son of Masashige KUSUNOKI and the younger brother of Masatsura KUSUNOKI.
He was the second son of Masashige KUSUNOKI and a younger brother of Masatsura KUSUNOKI.
sen.cmt: the younger brother of --> a younger brother of
sen.e: He was the second son of Masashige KUSUNOKI and a younger brother of Masatsura KUSUNOKI.

sen.j: 1348年、四條畷の戦いにおいて高師直・高師泰兄弟と戦って敗北し、兄・正行と刺し違えて自害。
sen.e: In 1346 during the Battle of Shijonawate, he fought against the brothers KO no Moronao and KO no Moroyasu and lost, and he committed suicide by falling upon each other's swords with his older brother Masatsura.

In 1346 in the Battle of Shijonawate, he fought against the brothers KO no Moronao and KO no Moroyasu and was defeated, as a result, he committed suicide together with his older brother Masatsura by stabbing each other.

In 1346 in the Battle of Shijonawate, he fought against the brothers KO no Moronao and KO no Moroyasu and was defeated, as a result, he committed suicide together with his older brother Masatsura by stabbing each other.
